p: In-hospital mortality increased significantly in relation to male sex, age, CCI, and qSOFA score (Table 3). The crude OR was 12.1 (95% confidence interval [CI] 6.9–21.0), 29.6 (15.3–57.3), and 52.1 (13–209.3) for qSOFA scores of 1, 2, and 3, respectively, which showed significant differences. The adjusted OR by c-statistics was 7.7 (95% CI 4.4–13.7), 11.9 (5.7–24.8), and 22.5 (4.3–116.3) when the qSOFA score was 1, 2, and 3, respectively.
